column1: #Text=The polycrystalline powders of Dy3+-doped KLa(PO3)4 (x=0.5%, 1%, 5% and 10%) have been prepared by solid state reaction [2].
#Text=Stoichiometric ratio of (NH4)2HPO4 (MERK, 99%), K2CO3 and Dy2O3 for 0.4 g of La2O3 (Fluka, 99.98%) were used as starting reagents according to the following reaction:
#Text=The mixture was finely ground in an agate mortar to ensure the best homogeneity and reactivity.
#Text=Then, it was poured into platinum crucible and heated progressively from room temperature to 400 °C (0.5 °C/min) and kept for 2 days at this temperature.
#Text=In the last step the obtained product was calcined at 600 °C (10 h) to eliminate residual water, CO2 and NH3.
